childMarkdownRemark.html:
Like a lot of kids growing up, I wanted to make video games. I figured out pretty quick that making games is more than just programming, but the love for doing low-level graphics code stuck with me.

This project is a learning project for various graphics techniques, and other game engine techniques.

Currently it supports:

  • a resource system that compiles meshes and textures to objects ready to use in the engine
  • a material system
  • colored directional lighting and shadow mapping

This is an (in-progress) React + Django CMS for mathNEWS, a campus publication I contribute to and edit.

Our old WordPress limited us to only being able to provide full PDFs of issues, and the WordPress editor did not support all the content that we can render in InDesign.

Highlights include:

  • a brand-new rich text editor that supports everything we publish
  • the ability to link to individual articles, increasing user engagement
  • an export pipeline that saves editors hours of time of InDesign formatting

This project, a polling station level map of Canadian election results, was an opportunity for me to combine my interests in politics and data visualization.

Highlights include:

  • a clean, preprocessed database of Canadian election results from 2004-2015, and a Python script to generate that data
  • an interactive, polling station level map of those results, built with MapBox
  • cool animated charts with D3
